CIPHER.170.cipherString: The world keeps happening, in accordance with its rules; it's up to us to make sense of it and give it value.
CIPHER.170.question: Solve this quote by Sean Carroll.

CIPHER.184.cipherString: To summarize the summary of the summary: people are a problem.
CIPHER.184.question: Decode this phrase by Douglas Adams which was encoded with with the Vigènere cipher using the keyword KNOWS.

CIPHER.179.cipherString: It is strange, butt rocks, properly chosen adn polished, can bee as beautiful as flowers, adn much more durable.
CIPHER.179.question: Solve this Aristocrat encoded quote by Isaac Asimov which was misheard and then typed in with mistakes before being encoded with a K2 alphabet.

CIPHER.176.cipherString: I firmly believe that unless one has tasted the bitter pill of failure, one cannot aspire enough for success.
CIPHER.176.question: Solve this Aristocrat which is a quote by A.P.J. Abdul Kalam which has the word THE in it once.

CIPHER.172.cipherString: Learn everything you can, anytime you can, from anyone you can, there will always come a time when you will be grateful you did.
CIPHER.172.question: Decode this phrase by Sarah Caldwell which has been encoded using the Atbash Cipher.

CIPHER.180.cipherString: What does it matter? Science has achieved some wonderful things, of course, but I'd far rather be happy than right any day.
CIPHER.180.question: Solve this K2 alphabet encoded Patristocrat which is a quote by Douglas Adams that starts with WHAT.

CIPHER.174.cipherString: I’ve never seen a job being done by a five-hundred-person engineering team that couldn’t be done better by fifty people.
CIPHER.174.question: Decode this phrase by C Gordon Bell which has been encoded using a Caesar Cipher.

CIPHER.187.cipherString: La ciencia es la llave a nuestro futuro y si no crees en ella, entonces estas reteniendo a todos.
CIPHER.187.translation: Science is the key to our future and if you do not believe in it, then you are holding everyone back.
CIPHER.187.question: Solve this Xenocrypt in Spanish which is a quote by Bill Nye that has been encoded with a K1 alphabet using an English keyword.

CIPHER.171.cipherString: Maybe this is why we read, and why in moments of darkness we return to books: to find words for what we already know.
CIPHER.171.question: Encode this phrase by Alberto Manguel using the Atbash Cipher.

CIPHER.186.cipherString: Books can be dangerous. The best ones should be labeled ‘This could change your life’.
CIPHER.186.question: Figure out what these strange headlines encoded using a Baconian alphabet mean.  It was said by Helen Exley and starts out with BOOK. What does it say?

CIPHER.183.cipherString: Science has given us the truth but taken away our tranquillity.
CIPHER.183.question: Encode this phrase by Amit Kalantri using the Vigenère cipher with a keyword of BEGUN.

CIPHER.178.cipherString: Inn recalling there school yaers, students mostly remember there teachers, and knot teh courses they took.
CIPHER.178.question: Solve this Aristocrat which is a common observation that was misheard by Alexa and encoded with a K1 alphabet.

CIPHER.181.cipherString: If there were no schools to take the children away from home part of the time, the insane asylums would be filled with mothers.
CIPHER.181.question: Solve this Patristocrat encoded quote by Edgar W. Howe with a K1 alphabet.

CIPHER.173.cipherString: Our species needs, and deserves, a citizenry with minds wide awake and a basic understanding of how the world works.
CIPHER.173.question: Encode this phrase by Carl Sagan using a Caesar cipher with a shift of 6.  I.e. A is encoded as G.

CIPHER.177.cipherString: In the battle between science and storytelling, there is simply no competition: storytelling wins every time.
CIPHER.177.question: Solve this Aristocrat which is a quote by Chris Chambers.

CIPHER.185.cipherString: Don't bother just to be better than your contemporaries or predecessors. Try to be better than yourself.
CIPHER.185.question: Decode this quote by William Faulkner which has been encoded using a Baconian cipher.

CIPHER.182.cipherString: Life is like a box of chocolates.
CIPHER.182.question: Encode this phrase from Winston Groom using the Affine cipher with a=19 and b=4.

CIPHER.188.question: Using a key of PUNT, compute the decryption matrix for a 2x2 Hill cipher using a 26 character alphabet.

CIPHER.175.cipherString: One of the wonders of science is that it is completely universal. It crosses national boundaries with total ease.
CIPHER.175.question: Solve this Aristocrat which is a quote by Brian Greene which has the word THAT in int once.
